proforma_date: Find the proforma date by labels "Date", "YMD/Date" or near the "PROFORMA INVOICE" header. Keep the exact format from the document (no normalization) and add it to proforma_date.
proforma_no: Extract the proforma number by labels "Proforma Invoice No", "No", "N". Keep the full string (letters/digits/symbols) and add it to proforma_no.
country_of_origin: If "Country of origin"/"ORIGIN OF GOODS" is explicitly shown, extract the country (e.g., "CHILE") and add to country_of_origin. If missing, leave empty.
HS_code: If "HS CODE"/"Tariff code" is shown, collect the codes exactly (e.g., 0304.81). If multiple, join with "; ". If codes differ by items, collect all unique and join with "; ". Add to HS_code.
additional_agreements: Extract the special terms/clauses section ("Additional agreements", "Notes", "Special terms", legal/compliance inserts). Keep the full text as one block (no shortening) and add to additional_agreements.
buyer: Identify the buyer by labels "Buyer", "Customer", "Senores/Customer", "Consignee". Keep the full name (and address if shown) in one line and add to buyer.
seller: Identify the seller by labels "Seller", "Supplier". Keep the legal name (and address if any) in one line and add to seller.
producer: If "Producer/Manufacturer/Processing plant" is shown (sometimes with "REG./Plant number"), extract the legal name. If a plant registration number is present, you may include it in the same line. Add to producer.
incoterms: Extract Incoterms (three-letter code EXW/FOB/CFR/CIF/DAP, etc.) and, if shown, the place (port/city), e.g., "CFR SAINT-PETERSBURG, RUSSIA". Add to incoterms.
terms_of_payment: Find payment terms ("Terms of payment", "Payment", "Forma de pago"). Keep the full wording (e.g., "ADV. 20%, BALANCE C/COPY DOC.") and add it to terms_of_payment.
bank_details: Extract bank details (bank, account/IBAN, SWIFT/BIC, beneficiary and address). Keep as a multiline block in original form and add it to bank_details.
total_price: Take the overall total ("Total ...", often with Incoterms and currency, e.g., "Total CFR 248.600,00"). Prefer the printed numeric value; if an amount in words is shown, do not replace the numeric total. Add to total_price.
products: The "products" block is expandable: create product_1, product_2, ... for each line item in the document, keeping order. For each position fill all available fields. If a shared attribute is given once (e.g., one Latin species for all lines), duplicate it in the relevant product_i. In token_refs include references to the source fragments (cells/rows) used.
products[*].name_product: Take the commercial name from "Description of Goods"/"Descripcion de la Mercaderia" (e.g., "FROZEN ATLANTIC SALMON FILLET TRIM D VP PREMIUM ..."). Join line breaks into one line. Add to products[i].name_product.
products[*].latin_name: If a Latin species name appears in parentheses (e.g., "SALMO SALAR"), extract it and add to products[i].latin_name. If absent, leave empty.
products[*].size_product: Extract size/grade (e.g., "3-4 LB (1.3-1.8 KG)", "80/120"). If both measurement systems are shown, keep both. Add to products[i].size_product.
products[*].unit_box: Record the accounting/pricing unit if explicitly shown ("per carton", "per kg", "unit", "Price per ..."). Add to products[i].unit_box; if not shown, leave empty.
products[*].packages: Extract the number of packages ("Packages", "Cases", "Cartons"). If only weight/quantity in kg is shown without package count, leave empty (do not infer). Add to products[i].packages.
products[*].net_weight: Take net weight per item ("Net weight", "Quantity/KG" if it is explicit net). Keep number and unit in the original format (dot/comma) and add to products[i].net_weight.
products[*].gross_weight: If gross weight is shown ("Gross weight"/"G.W.") per item, extract it. Keep number and unit in the original format. Add to products[i].gross_weight. If gross weight is missing, leave empty.
products[*].price_per_unit: Find unit price by labels "Unit Price", "Precio Unitario", "Price per ...". Keep currency and number format exactly as in the document. Add to products[i].price_per_unit.
products[*].total_price: Extract the line total ("Line total", "Amount", sometimes matches a line "Total ..."). If no explicit value, compute as quantity/weight x price_per_unit, keeping currency and format. Add to products[i].total_price.
